diagnosis.primary: Classic Hodgkin Lymphoma (CHL), Nodular Sclerosis type
diagnosis.sitesOfInvolvement: Bilateral Cervical nodes, Supraclavicular nodes, Mediastinal nodes (non-bulky)
diagnosis.symptomsAtPresentation: No B symptoms (Fever, Night Sweats, Weight Loss)

treatmentPlan.modality: Combined Modality Therapy (Chemotherapy followed by Radiation)
treatmentPlan.targetVolumeSummary: PTV_ISRT encompassing initially involved nodal regions (cervical, supraclavicular, mediastinal)
treatmentPlan.priorSystemicChemo: ABVD x 2 cycles (Completed 03/15/2025) with Deauville Score 2 response
medications: Topical cream PRN mild skin reaction

ctSimulation.setupInstructions: Supine in Aquaplast mask with arms down or on wing board. SAD setup.
ctSimulation.ctNotes: CT acquired for ISRT planning. Fused with diagnostic PET/CT for target delineation.

dosimetry.planNotes: Consolidation ISRT post-chemo. The historical 'Mantle Field' is larger; modern ISRT is used here to reduce toxicity.

fractions.setupNotes: Daily kV imaging, match to spine. Setup stable.

imagingAndReports.summary: Bilateral cervical, supraclavicular adenopathy. Mediastinal nodes upper limit normal size.
FDG-avid nodes matching CT findings in neck/supraclavicular regions, plus FDG-avid mediastinal nodes. Deauville 5.
Significant interval decrease in size/avidity of nodes. Residual uptake less than liver (Deauville Score 2).
CT acquired supine in mask for RT planning. Fused with diagnostic PET for target delineation.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Sarah Bell (Med Onc)
progressNotes.summary: 19yo M w/ biopsy-proven NS-CHL. Staging PET/CT confirms Stage IIA, non-bulky. Favorable risk factors. Discussed treatment options: standard is ABVD x 2 cycles followed by interim PET and likely 20 Gy ISRT. Explained rationale, goals, side effects. Pt agrees to proceed.

progressNotes.author: Chemo RN
progressNotes.summary: Patient educated on ABVD regimen, schedule, side effect management (nausea, fatigue, hair loss, low risk lung tox from bleomycin), when to call clinic. Port access demonstrated.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Sarah Bell (Med Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt completed 2 cycles ABVD, tolerated well. Interim PET shows excellent response (Deauville 2). Refer to Rad Onc for consolidation RT.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Robert Jones (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt s/p ABVDx2 for Stage IIA favorable CHL, Deauville 2 response. Plan for adjuvant RT 20 Gy / 10 fx to involved sites (ISRT). Discussed Mantle field concept vs modern ISRT. Explained RT procedure, skin care, thyroid monitoring. CT Sim scheduled.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Robert Jones (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Completed 5/10 fx RT. Mild throat soreness. No significant skin reaction yet. Tolerating well. Setup verification images reviewed (KV/CBCT), minor adjustments made. Continue RT.

patientEducation.goalsDiscussed: Curative-intent treatment. Consolidation radiation therapy after chemotherapy to maximize the chance of cure.
patientEducation.sideEffectsReviewed: Acute: Fatigue, mild skin redness (like sunburn) in the neck/chest, sore throat (esophagitis/mucositis), potential taste changes. Late: Small long-term risk of hypothyroidism, heart disease, and secondary cancers, which are minimized by using modern, smaller radiation fields (ISRT).
patientEducation.safetyConsiderations: Skin care (moisturizers, avoid sun exposure). Report severe sore throat, difficulty swallowing, or cough/shortness of breath.
patientEducation.patientResponsibilities: Attend daily RT, report symptoms, follow up for thyroid checks in the long term.
patientEducation.medicationCompliance: Use topical creams or mouthwash as recommended.
